Function Documentation

string char2ASCII (  string  s,
const string  escape = "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]"
) 
 

Given a string, replace any characters that match the regular expression with `_' where is the ASCII code for the characters replaced. If the pattern to be replaced is a WWW escape sequence, then replace the with an _ and keep the two digit ASCII code that follows it. Note that the ASCII code is in hex.

To escape all non-alphanumeric characters, use "[^A-Za-z0-9_]" for escape.

Parameters:
s The string to transform
escape A regular expression which matches the characters to replace. Note: Make sure that any expression given matches only a single character at a time (the default regex is handled specially).
Returns:
The modified string.

string esc2underscore (  string  s,
const string  escape = "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]"
) 
 

Return a string that has all the `%' sequences replaced with underscores (`_').

Parameters:
s The string to transform
escape A regular expression which matches the `%' pattern. By default this is the string "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]". Replacing the pattern allows the function to be used to map other patterns to an underscore.
Returns:
The modified string.

const string &  allowable
) 
 

Replace characters that are not allowed in DODS identifiers.

Parameters:
in The string in which to replace characters.
allowable The set of characters that are allowed in a URI. default: "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 0123456789_.!~*'()-";
Returns:
The modified identifier.

string id2www_ce (  string  in,
const string &  allowable
) 
 

Replace characters that are not allowed in WWW URLs. This function bends the rules so that characters that we've been sending in CEs will be sent unencoded. This is needed to keep the newer clients from breaking the old servers. The only difference between this function and id2www is that []:{}& have been added to the allowable set of characters.

Parameters:
in The string in which to replace characters.
allowable The set of characters that are allowed in a URI. default: "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 0123456789_.!~*'()-[]:{}&";
Returns:
The modified identifier.

string unescattr (  string  s  ) 
 

Un-escape special characters, quotes and backslashes from an HDF attribute.

Note: A regex to match one \ must be defined as: Regex foo = "\\\\"; because both C++ strings and GNU's Regex also employ \ as an escape character!

Parameters:
s The escaped attribute.
Returns:
The unescaped attribute.

string www2id (  string  in,
const string &  escape,
const string &  except
) 
 

Given a string that contains WWW escape sequences, translate those escape sequences back into ASCII characters. Return the modified string.

Parameters:
in The string to modify.
escape The character used to signal the begining of an escape sequence. default: "%"
except If there is some escape code that should not be removed by this call (e.g., you might not want to remove spaces, 20) use this parameter to specify that code. The function will then transform all escapes {except} that one. default: ""
Returns:
The modified string.
